Dinosaur, Iguanodon

This dinosaur seems comfortable on two legs or four. Its front limbs are each adorned with a cruel-looking, thumblike spike.



Iguanodon

CR 6

XP 2,400
N Huge animal
Init +2; Senses low-light vision, scent; Perception +12
DEFENSE
AC 19, touch 10, flat-footed 17 (+2 Dex, +9 natural, -2 size)
hp 76 (9d8+36)
Fort +10, Ref +8, Will +4
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft.
Melee 2 claws +13 (1d8+8/x3)
Space 15 ft.; Reach 15 ft.
Special Attacks thumb spikes
STATISTICS
Str 27, Dex 14, Con 19, Int 2, Wis 12, Cha 7
Base Atk +6; CMB +16; CMD 28 (32 vs. trip)
Feats Power Attack, Run, Skill Focus (Perception), Skill Focus (Stealth), Weapon Focus (claw)
Skills Perception +12, Stealth +4
ECOLOGY
Environment warm forests or swamps
Organization solitary, pair, or pack (3-6)
Treasure none
SPECIAL ABILITIES
Thumb Spikes (Ex) An iguanodon's thumb spikes can inflict grievous wounds-they deal triple damage on a successful critical hit.


Iguanodons are large, herbivorous dinosaurs that inhabit swamps and forests where they can take advantage of abundant vegetation. The iguanodon is capable of moving on two feet or on four, quickly switching from one stance to the other, depending on whether it needs to move through dense foliage or to reach delectable morsels hanging up in the canopy. Although iguanodons are herbivores, they are notoriously quick to anger. Their thumb spikes make their claws particularly devastating weapons-a well-placed blow from one of these claws can turn a hungry predator into a cowering beast with one swift strike. Iguanodons are 30 feet long and weigh 6,000 pounds.
